poem:
### The New Elegance

In the cradle of the morning,  
aromatic whispers rise—  
a transformation, from mere  
armpits misted to luxury's  
intimate sway. Essence  
crafts the day's armor, yes,  
transcending quid to  
crystalline. Would you pay  
the heavy scents' ransom  
for the silk touch of  
fragrant air?
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "It’s the pits! Would you pay £35 for one of the new, posh deodorants? Once humble, bought for a quid and used with little pleasure, deodorant has done an about-face. Where it used to be a simple case of misting armpits with Lynx or spritzing with Sure, in recent times the world of deodorant has evolved to offer products that cost as much as fancy face serums and smell as good as fine scents. Encapsulating". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
news: It’s the pits! Would you pay £35 for one of the new, posh deodorants? Once humble, bought for a quid and used with little pleasure, deodorant has done an about-face. Where it used to be a simple case of misting armpits with Lynx or spritzing with Sure, in recent times the world of deodorant has evolved to offer products that cost as much as fancy face serums and smell as good as fine scents.
